com.motorola.mod

Interface ModListener


  • public interface ModListener
    The callback interface which can be used by client app to get notified whenever there is a Moto Mod event, applications can register this via the ModManager.registerModListener

    The Moto Mod SDK enables an application to register a ModListner callback function which will be notified of changes over the Moto Mod. An application can register this callback this via the ModManager.registerModListener() API.

    The callback will be called :

    • when a new Moto mod is attached or detached
    • when an interface (corresponding to a protocol) is activated/deactivated
    • when the connection status of an attached Moto Mod changes
    • when a Moto Mod reports its capabilities have changed due to a battery, thermal or vendor defined event

    • Method Detail

      • onDeviceHotplug

        void onDeviceHotplug(ModDevice device,
                   boolean plug)
        The onDeviceHotplug() of the registered ModListener callback will be called when a Moto Mod is attached or detached from the Core. The onDeviceHotplug() will indicates the ModDevice which was attached or detached, and whether the event was an attach or detach.
        Parameters:
        device - the device of the module
        plug - true - plugged, false - unplugged

      • onInterfaceUpDown

        void onInterfaceUpDown(ModDevice device,
                     ModDevice.Interface iface,
                     boolean up)
        The onInterfaceUpDown() function of the registered ModListener callback will be called when an interface corresponding to a protocol is brought up or torn down. An application which needs to track availability of a specific interface should use this function to determine when -for example- the raw interface is available.
        Parameters:
        device - the device that the interface is associated with
        iface - the interface being brought up/down
        up - true - interface is up, false - interface is down

      • onConnectionStatusChanged

        void onConnectionStatusChanged(ModDevice device,
                             ModConnection conn)
        The onConnectionStatusChanged() function of the registered ModListener callback will be called when the connection status of a ModDevice changes. It will indicate the ModDevice which connection status changed, and the corresponding ModConnection object. An application can use the returned ModConnection object to determine the nature of the connection change.
        Parameters:
        device - the device that the connection is associated with
        conn - the MODConnection instance with the connection status

      • onLinuxDeviceChanged

        void onLinuxDeviceChanged(ModDevice mod,
                        ModInterfaceDelegation device,
                        boolean add)
        The onLinuxDeviceChanged() function of the registered ModListener callback will be called when a linux device node corresponding to a Moto Mod protocol interface is being created and removed.
        Parameters:
        mod - the device that the linux device node is associated with
        device - the Linux device delegation
        add - true - the device is being added, false - device removed.

      • onEnumerationDone

        void onEnumerationDone(ModDevice device)
        The onEnumerationDone(ModDevice) function of the registered callback will be called when a Moto Mod device has completed its the initialization and the core has enumerated all the modules in that device. If any of the interface within this Moto Mod device failed to initialized, the ModListener.onEnumerationDone(ModDevice, ModDevice.Interface, boolean) will be called, and the oneEnumerationDone() will not be called at all. This should be used when a application needs confirmation that the attached Moto Mod interfaces are reported as fully functional.
        Parameters:
        device - the Moto Mod device

      • onEnumerationDone

        void onEnumerationDone(ModDevice device,
                     ModDevice.Interface iface,
                     boolean status)
        The onEnumerationDone(ModDevice, interface, state) function of the registered callback will be called when an interface within a Moto Mod has completed its the initialization.
        Parameters:
        device - The Moto Mod device
        iface - The inteface
        status - True - All the protocols within this interface have setup their ModConnection instances and the state of them are ModConnection.State.ENABLED. False - Failed

      • onCapabilityChanged

        void onCapabilityChanged(ModDevice device)
        The onCapabilityChanged(ModDevice) function will be called when the capability of the Moto Mod has changed. Capability changes are reported by the Moto Mod over an asynchronous channel.

        The Moto Mod SDK provides a set of standard defined capability reasons and level for reporting, but a Moto Mod vendor can also define and report custom capability changed messages, which will be accessible with the getCapabilityVendor() API.

        When the onCapabilityChanged() callback is triggered, an application shoud use one of the API below to get details about the reported changes :
        • ModDevice.getCapabilityLevel(),
        • ModDevice.getCapabilityReason()
        • ModDevice.getCapabilityVendor()

        Note: different from ModManager.ACTION_MOD_CAPABILITY_CHANGED, the listener will always get callback here, despite whether it's the associated package of the Moto Mod or not.
